rounds.category: A PARADE OF THE WORST DICTATORS
rounds.comments: (Alex: This is a list from Parade magazine.)

clues.text: Than Shwe rules this country that moved its capital from Rangoon & leads the world in child soldiers
Hu Jintao is in charge here, where the rate of conviction is 99.7% & 250-300,000 dissidents are held without trial
No. 2 is this man of North Korea, which had the worst score on political rights & civil liberties for 34 straight years
Under Robert Mugabe of this country, life expectancy went from 62 to 38 years
No. 1 on the list is Omar al-Bashir of this country where 180,000 civilians have been killed in Darfur
Proverbially, true actors love the roar of the crowd & the smell of this stage makeup
Someone who practices weightlifting to develop his or her muscles & physical form
A shameful or immoral act is said to be one of these before God
If you fail to make your mortgage payments, the bank might place your property in this
The hard protective outer covering of an insect or a crustacean
In 1672 Louis Joliet was chosen to lead a Mississippi River expedition; this man was selected as chaplain
Joliet & Co. found that the Mississippi emptied into this body of water & not into the Pacific as they hoped
One of the skills that Joliet is remembered for was this one, from the Latin for "map drawing"
In 1676 Joliet formed a trading company to work on the north side of this river, the chief outlet of the Great Lakes
In 1671 Joliet was a signatory of a declaration increasing this king's realm in the New World

rounds.comments: (Alex: All the clues will refer to the books, not the movie.)

clues.text: This character gets a ride (likely to his home in Omaha) in the balloon meant to take Dorothy to Kansas
The Wicked Witch's golden cap allows her to summon these to do her bidding 3 times
Dorothy followed the Yellow Brick Road to this place, the capital of Oz
One chapter is called "The Magic Art of the Great" this 6-letter word meaning a hoax or fraud
In L. Frank Baum's original book, this, not ruby, is the color of Dorothy's slippers
Ranging from 1.3 to 3.6, degrees of this increase your potential score in Olympic diving
It's defined as the bending of light waves as they pass around the edge of an obstacle
Automotive gear allowing wheels to turn at separate speeds
A reserved or restrained manner often resulting in fatal hesitation
In anthropology, it's the spread of cultural features like tools or rituals from one group to another

rounds.comments: (Alex: And finally, we'll deal with an unpleasant subject...)

clues.text: Federal prison camps, also called this level of security, may have no perimeter fencing
Convict priest John Geoghan was kept in this, abbreviated PC, but was killed by another inmate in PC
In 1995 Arizona banned this recreation, fearing that it produced stronger criminals
Nazi imagery & ideas inspire this vicious "Brotherhood" that began in California prisons in the 1960s
It can mean a single charge of which you were convicted, or a procedure conducted several times a day

rounds.comments: (Alex: We'll name a book, you ID the movie based on it.)

clues.text: "Shoeless Joe"
"Monkey Planet"
"Wiseguy: Life in a Mafia Family"
"I, Tina: My Life Story"
clues.response: What's Love Got to Do with It

clues.text: "Do Androids Dream of Electric Sheep?"
Some Indians of the Amazon use the teeth of this vicious fish as scissors or razors
The bird spider, a member of this family of hairy spiders, usually eats beetles, but it does eat small birds on occasion
The Amazon species of this sea cow is the only one to live exclusively in fresh water
The Western Hemisphere's largest snake, it may live about 28 years--about a year a foot
Also called a water hog, this largest rodent in the world has webbed feet that make it a very good swimmer
The person in this position is typically small & light but has enough authority to tell rowers what to do
The end of the oar that slices through the water, it's usually painted with a country's or team's colors
As a verb, it refers to the motion propelling the boat; as a noun, it refers to the person who sets the pace
If you missed an Olympic berth at the Worlds, your last chance is at this qualification racing event
2 disciplines in rowing are sweeping, in which each rower pulls just one oar, & this, in which each rower uses 2 oars
He played fictional hero Perry Mason off & on from 1957 until his death in 1993
Christopher Plummer narrated a 1993 Family Channel series about this Paris schoolgirl
Pamela Sue Martin, who played this sleuth, left her show when it was merged with the Hardy Boys'
In 1979 this James Jones novel was a miniseries with Steve Railsback in Montgomery Clift's movie role
This 1994 miniseries based on a Stephen King book depicts the aftermath of a devastating plague
He lost the presidency by a 71-68 electoral vote count, so he settled for the VP slot in 1796
Speaking at Columbia Law School's 2000 commencement, he joked that he invented Lexis-Nexis
He found the press quite taxing, calling them "Nattering nabobs of negativism"
He only served 6 months as VP before he took the presidential oath of office in Buffalo
This ex-VP took the presidential oath of office from Judge Sarah Hughes, the first woman to administer it

rounds.comments: (Alex: We'll give you the origin, you give us the cliche in...)

clues.text: In hunting, dogs might chase their quarry up a tree, sometimes the dogs didn't choose the right tree
Sometimes a flintlock musket's fuse, called a pan, would flare up without firing the gun
On early warships, sailors & their wives slept between the cannons; the wives gave birth there as well
Deciphering hidden writing within a paragraph that couldn't be seen unless the paper was treated
A boxing technique where you move away so you won't feel the full force when a punch lands

rounds.text: Lyrics to an 1868 tune by this man began, "Guten Abend, Gut Nacht, Mit Rosen Bedacht"
